metadata.source: Zuora AI Agent and MCP Capability Documentation

mcp_overview.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) acts as the 'USB for AI' that standardizes how agents safely interact with Zuora's catalog, pricing, usage, billing, revenue, and workflow services across the revenue lifecycle.

current_state.developer_mcp: Local server for catalog CRUD, pricing configuration, SDK codegen, and knowledge tools for Q&A guidance
current_state.remote_mcp_server: Planned - exposes catalog, pricing, offer, billing, revenue tools to agents in Glean, Slack, and external LLMs under a single governed interface

mcp_overview.mcp_gateway: Single governed interface for partner and customer agents to discover and execute monetization operations. Enables PayPal checkout, Boomi agent iPaaS, and custom portal agents to interact with Zuora.
mcp_overview.strategic_positioning: MCP Server connects Zuora data and actions to AI agents, enabling intelligent automation across the order-to-revenue lifecycle

phases.name: Configure and Price
phases.key_question: Is our pricing driven by AI simulation and optimization?
phases.strategy_context: Move from static, hand-coded catalog and pricing setups to an Agentic Monetization Platform where specialist agents (pricing, catalog, revenue, channel) handle configuration and optimization work. MCP acts as the 'USB for AI' standardizing how agents safely talk to Zuora's catalog, pricing, usage, and workflow services.

capabilities.name: Offer/Catalog Management
capabilities.subtitle: Price, Usage, Promo
capabilities.why_it_matters: Catalog, bundles, and offers are the epicenter of Total Monetization, touching almost every Zuora service and channel. Today, many customers still suffer from SKU sprawl, fragmented offer logic, and duplication across CPQ, storefronts, and billing, which slows launches and complicates experimentation.

platform_features: Monetization Catalog & Offer Management provides a unified catalog for products, plans, bundles, and promotions with dynamic and attribute-based promotions and offers
Offer creation, management, cloning, and templates for business users
Dynamic, attribute-based promotions driven by customer, lifecycle, channel, and other context attributes
ai_agents: Developer MCP tools for catalog Q&A and setup guidance (Ask_Zuora style)
mcp_tools: Ingest & manage catalog
Create & manage product pricing / plans / rules
Managing product catalog (products, rate plans, charges)
Complex pricing structures (tiered, volume, overage, multi-attribute)
Guide product managers through catalog and pricing setup

capabilities.how_it_works_today: MCP tools encapsulate catalog operations (create product, define charges, configure pricing) behind a consistent schema. An AI agent interprets natural language like 'create a Pro plan with tiered usage and overage', calls MCP tools to generate payloads, validate pricing, and execute catalog changes. Uses knowledge tools to pull docs and examples for product managers. Can run locally via zuora-mcp for developers and internal product teams.

capabilities: Full 'Intelligent Commerce': GA of Intelligent Merchandising and Promotions Management unifying catalog, price, promotions, and merchandising with AI-powered offer optimization
AI-driven suggestion of new packages and bundles for segments, powered by usage and performance data
Integration of Business Context Service / Adaptive Context Service so agents can automatically tailor offers by GTM structure, channel, site, and customer history
Remote MCP Server / MCP Gateway enabling customers and partners to integrate Zuora into their own LLMs and agents

capabilities.name: Price Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: Customers want to innovate pricing models (usage, hybrid, commitments) without exploding SKUs or hard-coding rules in each channel. Pain points include rigid discounting and promotions, manual one-size-fits-all pricing, and high engineering cost to change price books.

platform_features: Dynamic and Attribute-Based Pricing using real-time business context (buyer segment, current subscriptions, site/catalog, channel, product context, and arbitrary attributes) to compute optimal prices
AI-powered pricing & offer management as a core pillar of Commerce strategy
ai_agents: Developer MCP for pricing configuration
mcp_tools: Configure all pricing charge types (flat, per-unit, tiered, volume, overage, high-watermark, multi-attribute)
Generate example payloads and SDK code in multiple languages
Read existing charge structures and tiers for a plan
Propose standardized patterns
Draft and execute payloads to standardize pricing

capabilities.how_it_works_today: An AI agent via MCP can read existing charge structures and tiers for a plan, propose standardized patterns (e.g., 'convert all these bespoke overrides into a multi-attribute formula'), and draft and execute payloads to standardize pricing across regions or products, while keeping human approval in the loop.

capabilities: Rules Engine + Merchandising rules: Introduction of a Rules Engine (rule builder and templates) and merchandising rules as natural 'homes' for AI-authored and AI-optimized pricing policies
Soft bundles and advanced policies (top-up, overage, rollover) governed consistently, enabling AI agents to reason across full price waterfalls
Insights-driven optimization: Price/Profit Optimization in Learn phase giving agents optimization targets (margin, growth, retention) to refine pricing rules over time

capabilities.name: Revenue Planning
capabilities.why_it_matters: Pricing and catalog changes are often made without a forward-looking financial view, leading to missed revenue targets, over- or under-monetized usage-based plans, and difficulty justifying changes to Finance and the board.

platform_features: Zuora Outcomes Simulation Agent runs AI-driven 'what-if' simulations on any plan, especially usage-based ones
Projects billing, revenue, and margin curves before changes go live
Plan comparison - overlay multiple candidate plans and compare projected outcomes side-by-side
AI recommendations - propose price points, tiers, and overage caps most likely to maximize revenue and minimize churn
Experimentation support - tag customers, meters, and plans for cohort analysis and iterative testing
ai_agents: Outcomes Simulation Agent (flagship capability)
mcp_tools: Pull plan and usage definitions from catalog and usage services via MCP
Apply scenario assumptions (volume growth, price change, tier boundary shifts)
Compute projected billing and revenue curves
Return visualizable data plus plain-language explanations

capabilities.how_it_works_today: The Outcomes Simulation Agent pulls plan and usage definitions from catalog and usage services via MCP, applies scenario assumptions, computes projected billing and revenue curves and returns them as visualizable data plus plain-language explanations. This moves pricing from backward-looking analytics to forward-looking 'what if' simulation, replacing guesswork with hard numbers.

capabilities: Deeper integration with Revenue and Finance Intelligence: Tighter linkage between simulations and Revenue Manager Agent and Finance Intelligence so planned catalog changes can be evaluated against revenue recognition and margin targets
Lifecycle-aware planning: Use context (segment, channel, lifecycle stage) and Learn-phase signals (churn, expansion) to feed richer assumptions into simulations
Moving toward autonomous 'AI-optimized monetization' across entry, profit, and retention

capabilities.name: Incentive Management
capabilities.subtitle: Rebates, Discounts
capabilities.why_it_matters: Today, many customers run promotions and rebates manually or in external tools, struggle to target incentives by lifecycle stage, channel, or behavior, and have limited feedback loops to know which discounts actually drive profitable growth.

platform_features: Offer Management and Promotion Management provide a flexible promotion model with dynamic, attribute-based offers incorporating any attribute: buyer segment, current subscriptions, site/catalog, channel
Stacking, exclusion, conditions, and templates so business users (not developers) can control incentive logic
Unifying pricing, packaging, and offers augmented by AI to holistically optimize for business outcomes
ai_agents: Developer MCP for offer configuration
mcp_tools: Propose incentive structures (trial discounts, lifecycle triggers, volume rebates)
Automatically configure corresponding offers and rules in Zuora via MCP
Validate eligibility and simulate financial impact using same pricing and usage context
Read current promotions and discount rules
Analyze performance (redemptions, churn impact) through DQ/insights agents

capabilities.how_it_works_today: An AI agent can read current promotions via MCP, analyze performance through connected data platforms and DQ/insights agents, recommend changes (e.g., phase-out low-ROI discounts, increase incentive for segments with high LTV) and push updated offers, subject to human approval.

capabilities: More intelligent incentive targeting: Tighter tie-in between churn insights, customer value intelligence, and promotion rules to enable AI-driven 'next best incentive' based on behavior and risk

MCP-exposed incentive APIs for partners: Via the MCP Gateway, partners (e.g., marketing platforms, commerce front-ends) can let their own agents request and apply optimal incentives per customer and channel, using Zuora as the policy and accounting system of record

capabilities.name: Channel Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: Enterprises increasingly sell through multiple channels: own storefronts, CPQ, partner portals, marketplaces, and now AI-led channels (chatbots, agents). Without a unified context layer: pricing and offers fragment by channel, partners get inconsistent incentives, and analytics on channel performance are siloed.

platform_features: Context-aware, omnichannel compare/configure/transact/manage experiences powered by Business Context Service / Adaptive Context Service
Resolves operating structure, location, channel, account/contracts, and session details into simple attributes for product recommendations, pricing, merchandising, and configuration

Zuora's Commerce Foundation powers packaging, pricing, eligibility, and offers across every channel—self-serve, Zephr, storefronts, CPQ, and agents—using one unified set of context, catalog, and decision services
ai_agents: Channel/partner agents using unified context
mcp_tools: MCP Server positioned to connect Zuora data and actions to AI agents across indirect channels
MCP Gateway ensures one AI port for monetization logic rather than bespoke integrations
Call context services to resolve channel, site, and customer attributes
Use catalog and offer APIs to render appropriate assortments and pricing

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Channel or partner experiences (e.g., Zephr, self-serve storefronts) can call context services to resolve channel, site, and customer attributes, use catalog and offer APIs to render appropriate assortments and pricing, and use early MCP-enabled tools so agents embedded in these channels can fetch product data, pricing, and offers consistently.

capabilities: Agent-led channels 'from day one': Strategy explicitly calls out sales-led, customer-led, and AI agent-led monetization flows—meaning indirect and automated channels will be first-class citizens for catalog, pricing, and offer execution

Partner / channel intelligence: In the Learn stage, Partner/Channel Intelligence and benchmarks feeding back performance data so AI agents can optimize which offers and prices to push via which channels

External agents via MCP for partners: Partners can host their own agents that discover eligible products and bundles, compute channel-specific pricing and incentives, and initiate orders into Zuora—while still governed centrally by Zuora policies

phases.name: Quote and Sell
phases.key_question: Can any channel create a quote using the same CPQ brain?
phases.strategy_context: Make quoting agentic and omnichannel. NextGen Zuora CPQ is being built as an AI-first, MCP-compliant CPQ where sales reps, partners, and even customers can 'quote anywhere' (CRM, portals, AI agents) against a single catalog, pricing, and contract brain. MCP is the standard way those agents call catalog, pricing, quote, and order services.

capabilities.name: Opportunity Capture
capabilities.subtitle: eCommerce, CRM, Partners
capabilities.why_it_matters: Today, opportunity → quote flows are often brittle: tightly coupled to one CRM, manually re-keyed from eCommerce, or disconnected from partner channels. We want a world where any channel (Salesforce, Dynamics, HubSpot, storefront, partner marketplace, AI agent) can initiate a quote using the same CPQ brain, without re-implementing rules.

platform_features: CPQ 'quote anywhere' architecture: NextGen CPQ can run quoting logic independently of any single CRM, with CRM-agnostic APIs for opportunity/quote sync
Late-bound price evaluation so pricing and configuration are resolved at quote time from real-time catalog and context
Quote gen from prompt and files and AI Assist – Pre-Quote allow starting from unstructured RFP/spec to draft a quote skeleton
Account Insights give AI-driven account context to drive quote structure and opportunity strategy
Auto-gen Renewal Quotes and mix quotes (new, amend, renew) connect billing/subscription history back into the selling motion
ai_agents: Quote Agent
Account Insights
mcp_tools: Pull pricing rules (GET /catalog/price-rules)
Fetch and mutate quotes (GET /quote/{id}, PATCH /quote, POST /order)
Simulate and execute end-to-end quote-to-order flows from an opportunity
Read opportunity context (segment, region, ARR target, existing subs)
Propose a quote including dynamic pricing and bundles

capabilities.how_it_works_today: CRM/eCommerce surfaces sync opportunities and quote IDs with CPQ. An AI quote agent (running via MCP server) can read opportunity context (segment, region, ARR target, existing subs), call MCP tools to propose a quote, including dynamic pricing and bundles, and hand the draft back into CPQ for human review and approval.

capabilities: Full 'Quote Anywhere' LLM-layer: JSON-based quote definition language specifically designed to be LLM-generatable ('Quote for 500 Enterprise users in APAC with a 3-year ramp')
CRM/eCommerce/partner agents creating and adjusting quotes via this declarative spec
Richer data fusion at opportunity time: Deeper integration of revenue/collections insights (from billing, rev rec, and cash) into CPQ rules and AI scoring

capabilities.name: Customer and Partner Portals
capabilities.why_it_matters: Growth motions increasingly start in self-serve (customer portals, storefronts, partner marketplaces), not just direct sales. Historically, self-serve portals and CPQ used different product/price logic, causing inconsistent offers and manual reconciliation.

platform_features: Hosted Checkout, Embedded Checkout, Self-Serve Portal for subscription management, payments, and self-service changes
Widget libraries for embedding customer experiences (product detail pages, portal elements) into customer-owned sites
Z-CPQ Portal with widgets for partners and internal reps, integrated with CRMs like Salesforce
Partner Portal & disti widgets for VAR/distributor reps to create solution price requests (SPR) and quotes
ai_agents: Customer-facing agents in portals
Partner agents
mcp_tools: Read usage, entitlements, and current subscriptions
Recommend upgrades/add-ons and create a quote request
Build an SPR, apply rules and discounts, and hand to provider's CPQ for finalization

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Portal and partner widgets rely on the same catalog and CPQ services that are being MCP-enabled. A customer-facing agent in a portal can read usage, entitlements, and current subscriptions, recommend upgrades/add-ons and create a quote request. A partner agent can build an SPR, apply rules and discounts, and hand it to the provider's CPQ for finalization.

capabilities: Omnichannel, AI-ready experiences: Strategy explicitly calls out omnichannel commerce APIs and embeddable experiences so self-serve, Zephr, storefronts, CPQ, and agents all share the same context, catalog, and decision services

AI-augmented self-serve quoting: Self-serve users will get AI-guided 'quote request → assisted quote' flows (Quote Request self2assisted, guided product discovery), using the same agents that help sales reps in CPQ

capabilities.name: Guided Selling
capabilities.subtitle: CPQ, Price Guidance
capabilities.why_it_matters: Complex subscription deals involve many product combinations, ramps, and commitments, non-obvious margin and rev-rec implications, and frequent back-and-forth with the customer. Reps and partners need guided, policy-aware quoting, not just a big grid of SKUs.

platform_features: Guided Selling: Product Discovery - Questionnaire-style guided selling that recommends and pre-filters products in the catalog for a given solution with AI-first question generation
Deal Assist / Deal Sense agent creates alternative quote scenarios, staying within financial and product boundaries
Smart Guided Selling and NLP-based quote generation dynamically adapts discovery and quoting paths in real time
Surfaces recommendations like 'The combination of Product A + Feature X has a 60% rejection rate, consider Feature Y instead' or 'Your quote is 18% above average for similar deals in this vertical'
Dynamic Pricing in CPQ uses account, opportunity, and quote context to drive product, rate plan, and charge pricing
Visualization of Deal Score, margin, rev rec, and account metrics to give guided selling financial guardrails
ai_agents: Deal Assist / Deal Sense Agent
Quote Agent
mcp_tools: Pull configuration rules and price rules
Simulate quote alternatives and validate policy compliance before presenting options

capabilities.how_it_works_today: AI Deal Assist agent creates alternative quote scenarios, staying within financial and product boundaries, and helping reps adapt to changing customer needs (ramps, amendments, renewals) over time. Smart Guided Selling dynamically adapts discovery and quoting paths in real time.

capabilities: Deeper 'agent-in-the-loop' selling: Quote agents that continuously score the deal (win likelihood, margin, risk), suggest moves (change term, adjust bundle, swap product) in conversational form

Tighter integration with Learn & Optimize: Guided selling success/failure data feeding back into offer and price optimization, so the agent learns which bundles, incentives, and price points work for which segments and channels

capabilities.name: Customer Risk and Fraud Check
capabilities.why_it_matters: High-value B2B deals carry both credit risk (likelihood of non-payment/delinquency) and fraud/identity risk (illegitimate buyers, abusive behavior). If we can surface risk at quote time, sales and finance can adjust terms (prepayment, deposits, caps) before committing.

platform_features: Customer Risk & Fraud Check listed as AI use case in Quote & Sell (IDC research with Zuora)

Risk indicator score (1–10) evaluating quotes on: Legal T&Cs text, Customer payment history, Similar customers in same vertical/region, Quote complexity and delays, Delivery issues on similar past deals
AI-first handling: using AI to analyze these factors and explain the risk
ai_agents: Risk scoring agents (design stage)
mcp_tools: Consume billing/collections history and contract metadata via MCP
Contribute features for risk scoring

capabilities.how_it_works_today: This is early/design-stage. No GA 'fraud engine' but requirements have established the risk score is part of CPQ's decisioning. AI agents can consume billing/collections history and contract metadata (via MCP & DQ/insight tools) to contribute to that score.

capabilities: AI-driven risk gating in CPQ: Integrate quote risk scores into approval rules (deals above risk threshold require finance/legal approval)
Guided selling suggesting adjusted terms for high-risk deals
Integration with external fraud/credit engines via MCP Gateway

capabilities.name: Contract Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: Complex subscription contracts span multiple years with amendments, renewals, and commitments. Manual contract management creates audit gaps and slows deal velocity.

platform_features: CPQ contract lifecycle management
Quote-to-contract-to-order flows
ai_agents: Quote Agent for contract context
mcp_tools: Read current subscriptions and contracts
Generate proposed quotes including amendments

capabilities.how_it_works_today: CPQ manages contract state. AI agents can read contract context via MCP to inform quoting and renewal strategies.

capabilities: AI-assisted contract analysis and amendment suggestions
Automated contract compliance checking
Natural language contract querying

capabilities.name: Inventory/Ship Availability
capabilities.why_it_matters: For hybrid XaaS businesses (physical + digital + services), quoting must respect inventory pools and availability dates, and reflect realistic ship/activation timelines. Historically, this logic often lives outside of Zuora, making it hard for AI-driven quoting to know what can actually be delivered, when.

platform_features: Inventory: Visibility, Pools, Management as part of Commerce Management Services
Fulfillment and Ship in Provision, tied to entitlement and deployment
ai_agents: Quoting agents with availability awareness
mcp_tools: Query stock levels, pools, and locations for the requested configuration
Estimate ship or activation windows and present them in the quote
Adjust offers or channels when a given SKU/pool is constrained

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Inventory and fulfillment services form the basis for exposing availability and pool data to CPQ and agents. As these services are MCP-wrapped, quoting agents will be able to query availability and present realistic timelines.

capabilities: Quote-aware availability: Tighter integration between Order State Management, Inventory Management, and CPQ
AI-guided configuration and dynamic pricing factoring in availability and fulfillment costs
Channel agents (partner portals, marketplaces) only offering what's actually fulfillable in their region/inventory pools

phases.name: Invoice
phases.key_question: How many invoicing errors were flagged and fixed by an agent today?
phases.strategy_context: Move from manual, ticket-driven billing ops to self-healing billing flows. MCP is the 'USB for AI' that lets agents safely access billing, invoicing, rating, mediation, and data-quality tools across tenants. Specialist agents include Billing/Invoice Service Agents, Mediation/DACO Agents, DQ/Trino Agent, Data Management Agent, Notification AI Bot, and Billing Operations Agent.

capabilities.name: Order Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: Order data (from CPQ, portals, partners) is the source of truth for what should be billed. Historically, order orchestration is spread across CRMs, custom middleware, and Zuora, making it hard for AI to reason about 'what should have happened vs what did' when invoices are wrong.

platform_features: Extensible, callable & composable components (proration/rating, bill run, order orchestration) as part of a unified business process framework
Core processes (Billing, Invoicing, Renewals) refactored for self-service/partner extensibility and AI/agent extensibility
ai_agents: Billing Operations Agent works against the order–invoice chain, checking bill-run quality and subscription state
Invoice Service Agent and Billing Agent aligned to 'Invoice & Collect… troubleshooting leakage'
Workflow AI Bot encapsulates typical order-to-bill playbooks as MCP tools
mcp_tools: Inspect orders, invoices, subscriptions as a coherent graph
Trigger order-driven workflows (re-apply an order impact, replay an orchestration step)
Fix downstream billing issues

capabilities.how_it_works_today: For now, agents are primarily diagnostic/assistive. Billing/Invoice Agent can analyze a problematic customer and say: 'This invoice mismatch stems from Order X not fully applied to Subscription Y; here's the recommended fix.' The Workflow AI Bot concept encapsulates typical order-to-bill playbooks as MCP tools, automating multi-step remediation.

capabilities: Composable order-to-bill agents: Standard MCP tools for order orchestration (create/amend order, re-orchestrate, re-align billing schedule)
Billing Ops Agents can go beyond diagnosis and execute fixes safely
Customer-facing agents can simulate order impacts on future invoices before changes are committed
Tighter CPQ–Billing coupling via MCP: Same agent can see how quote was structured, how orders were created, how billing executed—closing the loop for autonomous corrections

capabilities.name: Billing, Invoice
capabilities.why_it_matters: Billing operations teams are under pressure to run large, complex bill runs reliably, avoid errors that trigger disputes and re-runs, and explain variance quickly to customers and finance.

platform_features: Unified Data Platform & Reporting: Single workspace across Commerce + Billing + AR + Revenue powering both human and AI agent operations
Real-time bill forecasting and simulations to predict invoice volumes and anticipate cash flows and exceptions
ai_agents: Billing/Invoice Service Agents: Focus on BFD, billing node details, and invoicing issues via Omni/Kibana
Billing Operations Agent: Pre/post QA checks on monthly bill runs with anomaly detection, reactivate suspended subscriptions, suspend access/billing based on triggers
Notification AI Bot: Autonomous alert recognition, impact analysis, and remediation—key to systems that 'fix their own billing errors without a human ticket'
mcp_tools: Remote MCP Server for billing agents in Glean/Slack/Co-pilot to call bill run, invoice, and journal APIs
External MCP-compatible agents (customer or partner bots) can use Zuora's billing logic safely

capabilities.how_it_works_today: A typical flow: Billing Ops Agent reviews a planned bill run → runs pre-run QA with anomaly checks → flags suspicious spikes/voids. If errors occur, Notification AI Bot ingests alerts, summarizes impact ('X customers affected; invoices Y–Z wrong'), and invokes standard playbooks (pause, fix data, re-bill).

capabilities: More proactive and autonomous billing: Scaling agents from 'assist' to 'self-healing'—auto-skip obviously corrupted batches, suggest or perform targeted re-billing with full audit trails
Bill explanations on demand: For CS and finance, agents that can narrate why an invoice changed in plain language (similar to Revenue Narrator), saving 20+ minutes per customer email

capabilities.name: Rating and Charging
capabilities.why_it_matters: Complex rating (commitments, tiers, FX, multi-entity) is where revenue leakage often hides. As usage and pricing models get more granular, manual configuration and debugging of rating flows doesn't scale.

platform_features: Callable rating components: 'proration/rating' as extensible, callable, composable components exposed for AI and workflow reuse
Dynamic & attribute-based pricing from Configure & Price flows directly into rating with real-time business and customer context
ai_agents: Mediation/DACO Agents fix rating/mediation issues that cause downstream rating failures
DQ/Trino Agent runs health checks and query reports across underlying rating data stores
mcp_tools: Developer MCP + knowledge tools help set up complex rating/charge models correctly
Identify rating failures or skewed data before or after bill runs

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Today, AI is mainly in configuration & troubleshooting. Developer MCP + knowledge tools help set up complex rating/charge models correctly. Mediation/DACO and DQ agents identify rating failures or skewed data before or after bill runs.

capabilities: AI-assisted rating optimization: As Usage Anomaly Detection and billing forecasting mature, agents will recommend different rating strategies (e.g., accrual vs billing-based, different tier breakpoints) for specific segments

Composable rating via MCP: Standard MCP tools for rating (simulate rating for a given account/meter/time range) will let agents test rating changes before deployment and help GS/partners adopt new rating models faster ('AI-driven implementation')

capabilities.name: Usage Data Mediation
capabilities.why_it_matters: For usage/consumption models, garbage in = garbage out. Bad or late mediation leads to mis-rating, bill-run delays, disputes, and revenue restatements. Mediation is often one of the most complex, least visible parts of the stack.

platform_features: Telco-grade mediation, metering and rating
Mediation capabilities improving integration with Zuora billing with basic AI capabilities
ai_agents: Mediation/DACO Agents: Functional specialists responsible for Data Connect and Mediation troubleshooting
Anantha Concierge and Zuora AI Concierge orchestrate Mediation Agents together with Billing and DB agents
mcp_tools: Check if mediation jobs ran as expected
Inspect sample usage feeds and transformed records
Point SREs to misconfigured sources or mappings faster than manual log-hunting

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Agents can check if mediation jobs ran as expected, inspect sample usage feeds and transformed records, and point SREs to misconfigured sources or mappings faster than manual log-hunting.

capabilities: AI-driven mediation health & mapping: Usage anomaly detection plus AI-assisted mapping from raw feeds to standardized meters, reducing GS effort in implementations
MCP-exposed mediation tools: Mediation pipelines exposed as MCP tools for both internal and partner agents (e.g., a partner's data-prep agent validating feeds before sending to Zuora)

capabilities.name: Anomaly Detection
capabilities.why_it_matters: Without automation, teams catch anomalies only when customers complain or finance spots variance. At scale, manual review of invoices, usage, and rating logs is impossible.

platform_features: Usage anomaly detection
Dynamic validation framework with real-time anomaly detection and adaptive checks

phases.name: Collect
phases.key_question: Are failed payments being remediated by a bot before a human is alerted?

capabilities.why_it_matters: Handling transaction flows efficiently across payment methods, currencies, and regions is foundational to cash collection.

Smart routing capabilities
ai_agents: Collections agents with payment context
mcp_tools: Payment method management
Transaction routing optimization

MCP exposure for customer-facing bots to retrieve invoice + payment status and trigger safe payment actions (retries, method updates) under policy

capabilities.name: Customer Credit Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: Poor visibility into credit risk leads to over-extended customers and rising bad debt, or overly conservative terms that slow growth. Credit signals sit across billing, payments, disputes, and collections, making them hard to operationalize without AI.

platform_features: Customer Credit Management as a core recurring-revenue capability in Collect stage

Unified reporting and forecasting across billing + payments providing normalized data for payment history, DSOs, aging, dispute patterns, contract structures
ai_agents: Collections agents with credit context
mcp_tools: Analyze customer communications and billing situation
Sort customers into automated vs high-touch actions

capabilities: Credit-aware agents in Collect: Compute credit risk scores using billing + payment history + disputes

capabilities.name: Dunning and Payment Retry
capabilities.why_it_matters: Traditional dunning is template-based not personalized, reactive and slow, and hard to optimize against both recovery rate and churn risk.

Proactive collections chatbot that engages customers to show simplified bills and collect payment in their preferred channel/method
ai_agents: Notification AI Bot: For failed payments—automating dunning/retry triggers
Collections Manager Agent: Persona-specific agent aimed at automating collections and follow-up workflows
mcp_tools: Sort customers into automated dunning vs priority queues
Trigger dunning workflow entry or CS handoff
Summarize which customers and amounts are impacted

capabilities: Adaptive dunning strategies: Use customer value, engagement history, and credit risk to automatically choose dunning tone, channel, and cadence, and select which retries are worth attempting

capabilities.name: Collections
capabilities.why_it_matters: Collections teams are overloaded: manually prioritizing accounts, writing bespoke emails and call scripts, reconciling disputes and partial payments across systems. This is a prime area for AI agents as 'workforce multipliers'.

platform_features: Collections Manager Agent is an explicit persona in the Zuora AI agent lineup

Predictive models to identify probable non-payment or churn events and engage customers proactively

Unified monetization workspace and Collections modules provide data + execution rails for AI decisions

Route low-value/low-risk cases to automated flows

Collections workflows route low-value/low-risk cases to automated flows and high-impact accounts to human collectors, with AI-generated context and scripts.

capabilities: Full 'Collections Copilot': Collections Agent using MCP to pull a 360° view (subscriptions, invoices, payments, disputes), score accounts by collectability and strategic importance, auto-suggest next actions (calls, offers, settlements) and execute low-risk steps under policy

capabilities.name: Partner Settlement

capabilities.why_it_matters: Many Zuora customers sell through resellers, distributors, marketplaces and owe rebates, revenue shares, and incentives based on complex subscription and usage metrics. platform_features: Partner Settlement under Collect in the lifecycle
Partner/Channel Intelligence and Benchmarks in Learn phase as part of the analytic loop

ai_agents: Revenue and AR agents for reconciliation
mcp_tools: MCP + unified data platform give AI agents structured access to partner accounts and contracts, invoices, usage, revenue recognition records

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Partner settlement is still primarily rules + reporting-driven, with Revenue and AR agents helping ensure the underlying data is accurate and reconciled before settlements are calculated and paid.

phases.name: Provision
phases.key_question: Is customer access granted automatically via an MCP-governed workflow?
phases.strategy_context: Go from manual hand-offs between billing and downstream systems to instant, policy-driven access and fulfillment. MCP and the Remote MCP Server provide the standard way agents call entitlement, inventory, order-state, and provisioning workflows. Anantha (Concierge) and Infra/DACO Agents are the relevant specialists.

capabilities.name: Entitlement Management
capabilities.why_it_matters: For digital and hybrid businesses, entitlements are the real product—they determine which features, content, seats, and environments each customer can use. Without robust entitlements: provisioning is brittle and manual, upsell/cross-sell and churn prevention are harder to automate, and audit/compliance around 'who had access to what, when' is weak.

platform_features: Entitlement Management as part of the Monetization Catalog and commerce foundation
Workflow for Entitlements Provisioning and Execution, Order Orchestration
Features & Entitlements simplify product creation and provisioning by automating feature gating instead of relying on custom objects
Integrated entitlements power intelligent upsell, cross-sell and churn mitigation through dynamic, AI-driven offers
ai_agents: Developer MCP for entitlement setup
Catalog + Features & Entitlements are part of the Race-to-50 AI feature set
mcp_tools: Define and reuse features across products
Automate provisioning and entitlements based on what the customer buys
Ask 'what should this customer be entitled to now?'
Adjust entitlements when orders or contracts change

capabilities: Autonomous entitlement updates on order/contract changes
Customer-facing agents explaining entitlements
Integrated upsell/cross-sell powered by entitlement gaps

capabilities.name: Inventory
capabilities.why_it_matters: Tracking physical or digital stock accurately is essential for fulfillment and avoiding over-promising in quotes.

Integration with fulfillment workflows

mcp_tools: Query inventory levels and pools
Update availability based on orders

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Inventory services integrated with commerce and fulfillment. AI starting to assist in availability queries.

capabilities: Real-time inventory-aware quoting
AI-driven inventory optimization recommendations

capabilities.name: Fulfillment and Ship
capabilities.why_it_matters: For hybrid products (physical + digital), digital entitlements must be applied and partners/systems must stay in sync. Without automation: Fulfillment teams chase spreadsheets and tickets, and pauses, resumes, address changes, and returns lead to errors.

capabilities.name: Deployment / Provisioning
capabilities.why_it_matters: For SaaS and digital products, provisioning is the moment of truth—customers expect instant access after payment or order approval. Delays cause dissatisfaction and churn risk. Manual activation and de-provisioning create errors and audit gaps.

Automatic access grant (token generation, platform setup, service enablement)
De-provisioning upon cancellation or change, updating entitlements accordingly

phases.name: Recognize and Report

phases.strategy_context: Move from manual, spreadsheet-heavy close and reporting to AI-assisted, explainable, and auditable revenue operations. MCP Servers + Unified Data Platform expose billing, revenue, AR, and benchmark data to AI agents.

capabilities.name: Revenue Recognition

Reconciliation AI: Automates data recon between revenue subledger and ERP/GL

Revenue Manager Agent: Handles Audit Preparation, Financial Reporting acceleration, and Multi-year forecasting
mcp_tools: MCP Servers expose revenue schedules, usage, and billing context
Work directly on Zuora's complex revenue models rather than relying on exports

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Agents support revenue recognition by validating transaction staging and contract groupings, explaining period-over-period revenue movements in natural language, and highlighting anomalies or policy deviations. capabilities: More autonomous close & insight: 'Autonomous Close & Insights'—automated variance explanations, AI reconciliation & exception detection, pre-close risk diagnostics

Platform explicitly designed for AI agents as well as human users

AI-driven diagnostics on ledger mismatches

capabilities: More automated journal workflows: Closer coupling of Billing & Revenue journal integrations with Reconciliation AI so journals are validated before posting and exceptions are auto-flagged with recommended corrections
AI-first ledger narratives: Revenue Manager Agent and Revenue Narrator extending into GL impact explanations for the board and auditors

capabilities.why_it_matters: For usage-based and entitlements-driven models: Over-consumption without enforcement → revenue leakage & SLA risk. Over-enforcement → poor customer experience. Enforcement needs to be contract-aware and entitlement-aware.

Customer-visible transparency: Portal/chat agents that explain 'What am I entitled to?', 'Why was this overage applied?', 'What are my options to stay within limits?'—all backed by actual entitlements and usage via MCP

capabilities.name: Reporting and Dashboards
capabilities.why_it_matters: Today, many customers export to spreadsheets/BI tools, spend days building board decks, and struggle to get real-time, cross-product views. AI-ready reporting requires a unified, trusted data layer.

Single source of truth for all monetization reporting
Dramatically faster time-to-insight and reduced custom report building
ai_agents: Query Assistant / Revenue Data Query: Natural language queries with auto-generated, validated SQL for ad-hoc revenue analysis
Revenue Narrator and Revenue Manager Agent: Generate narrative explanations and pull together data for financial reporting and multi-year forecasts
Operational Intelligence providing structured and secured access for both humans and AI agents
mcp_tools: Access subscriptions, invoices, revenue schedules, metrics
Compute and explain revenue/profit KPIs

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Customers can use unified reporting (new data warehouse + reporting layer) to query across billing and revenue in one interface. AI-powered querying and narratives layer on top.

capabilities: Board decks generated via AI
Real-time, conversational dashboards
Role-aware, permission-aware data access for agents

capabilities.name: Compliance
capabilities.why_it_matters: Compliance spans financial reporting (GAAP/IFRS), auditability (clear trails of who did what, when, and why), and operational incidents (RCAs, security, data handling). AI must improve compliance, not undermine it.

ai_agents: RCA Agent: Assists in drafting Root Cause Analyses using standardized templates
DQ/Trino Agent & Data Management Agent: Provide continuous data validation, anomaly detection, and adaptive thresholds, supporting continuous audit readiness
mcp_tools: Draft incident and compliance summaries
Continuous data validation and audit readiness
Link revenue changes to contracts and workbench actions

capabilities.why_it_matters: Leaders need forward-looking and driver-based views of revenue, margin, and cash, and product/channel profitability. Today, many rely on manual spreadsheets and siloed BI.

ai_agents: Revenue Accountant Agent and Revenue Manager Agent: Explain revenue behavior, accelerate reporting, enable multi-year revenue forecasting (GAAP and non-GAAP)

mcp_tools: MCP Servers expose subscriptions, invoices, revenue schedules, and metrics

capabilities: Autonomous close & insight loops: Closer integration of Revenue/Finance agents, bill forecasting, and anomaly detection to provide pre-close diagnostics, automated variance explanations, and continuous profitability views across product/segment/channel

platform_features: Zephr AI Paywall: Uses ML to personalize subscription offers in real-time (FT example: near-doubling of conversions and 78% lift in LTV)
Collections AI & AR signals: Automate workflows, predict payment/non-payment, connect billing+CRM+support data—key inputs into churn risk and win-back targeting
Unified Data Platform combines usage, billing, revenue, AR, and CPQ in one layer for both humans and agents
ai_agents: Churn Agent: In-progress business agent focused on anomalies and behavioral patterns around churn
Customer Health Agent: Monitors subscriber signals in real time, flags churn risks, proactively recommends next-best actions to preserve and grow recurring revenue
mcp_tools: MCP Servers expose context (subscriptions, usage, invoices, collections status)
Churn and health agents can compute risk and invoke tools that drive win-back offers in CPQ, paywalls, or campaigns

capabilities.how_it_works_today: Early implementations use churn/health scoring plus AI-driven offers (e.g., via Zephr AI Paywall) to identify segments at risk and present retention offers (discounted terms, downgraded plans, added value) via digital channels.

capabilities: Closed-loop churn prevention: Tie together Churn Agent + Customer Health Agent, CPQ/offer engines (for B2B) and AI paywall/personalization (for B2C), and Collections and CS workflows, so agents can select and deploy the right win-back playbook per customer, with clear measurement of retention and profitability

capabilities.name: Renewals
capabilities.subtitle: CPQ, Upsell/Cross-sell
capabilities.why_it_matters: Renewal moments are the best point for expansion (upsell, cross-sell) and also a major churn risk if renewals are manual, late, or mis-priced.

platform_features: CPQ: Combines new sales, amendments, and renewals into a single quote, visualized in a purpose-built UI
Auto-gen Renewal Quotes: CPQ roadmap includes auto-generated renewal quotes from contract state and usage history
AI-assisted renewal strategy: Renewal → AI agent provides insights on how to make the renewal (expansion, pricing, structure)
Guided selling + dynamic pricing features apply equally to renewals and expansions
ai_agents: Deal Assist / Deal Sense agents: Generate alternative quote scenarios to meet financial and product boundaries, very relevant in renewal/amendment contexts
mcp_tools: CPQ catalog and order services are MCP-compliant
Read current subscriptions and contracts
Generate proposed renewal quotes (including upsells/cross-sells)
Push into CPQ for approval and order conversion

capabilities.how_it_works_today: AI-assisted renewals use account insights + contract history to auto-generate renewal quotes, propose expansion paths and pricing, and let reps or CS accept, tweak, or compare alternatives in CPQ.

capabilities: Fully agentic renewal flows for B2B: Agents that watch renewal horizons and pre-stage renewal/expansion quotes with recommended structures and pricing, routed via CPQ workflows
For B2C/hybrid: Integration with AI Paywall & Customer Health Agent to coordinate self-serve renewal offers and assisted renewal with sales/CS for high-value accounts

capabilities.name: Customer Success
capabilities.subtitle: Health, Education
capabilities.why_it_matters: Customer Success teams must monitor health signals (usage, tickets, payments, sentiment), drive adoption and expansion, and educate users and stakeholders at scale. Doing this manually across many customers doesn't scale.

platform_features: Zuora AI explicitly includes a Customer Success Agent in the persona-specific agent set
Strategy: one Concierge Agent orchestrates domain-specific agents (Billing, Revenue, Collections, Orders, Customer Health) to deliver unified response and guidance to CS users
Zuora AI Help: Gen-AI assistance across Knowledge Center, Developer Center, Support—guiding users to answers and self-resolution as an education layer
Unified Data Platform: Gives CS a single view of Commerce + Billing + AR + Revenue data, which agents can narrate and interpret for health and success planning
ai_agents: Customer Success Agent: In persona-specific agent set
Customer Health Agent: Monitors signals in real time, flags churn risks, recommends actions
Zuora AI Help: Education layer for product and billing concepts
mcp_tools: MCP Servers expose subscriptions, invoices, usage, revenue, collections, and entitlements
Allows CS and health agents to compute health scores and generate recommended plays by reading directly from Zuora context

capabilities.how_it_works_today: CS teams can use reporting + early health/churn agents to get account-level metrics and narratives. Use Zuora AI Help and docs-optimized content to educate both internal users and customers on product behavior.

capabilities: End-to-end Customer Success playbooks: CS agents that continuously monitor health and product adoption, trigger playbooks (education campaigns, success plans, EBR prep, renewal prep) via MCP-integrated tools (email, CRM, in-app messaging)

Proactive education & in-product guidance: Deeper integration of AI Help into the product and customer portals—context-aware help and education driven by actual contract and usage context; CS teams can configure AI-driven journeys instead of one-off enablement
